title: High Reliance on Remittances
description: In 2022, remittances accounted for 41.94% of Tonga's GDP, highlighting a significant reliance on funds sent from abroad.

title: Low External Debt Levels
description: As of 2023, Tonga's total external debt stood at $196.45 million, one of the lowest globally, indicating limited borrowing from international sources.

title: Minimal Trademark Activity
description: In 2021, only 3 trademark applications were filed by residents, reflecting low levels of domestic innovation and brand creation.

title: Decline in Household Consumption
description: Tonga experienced a significant decline in household consumption expenditure, with a decrease of 20.98% in 2022, indicating economic challenges for families.

title: High Taxation on Goods and Services
description: In 2023, taxes on goods and services represented 25.56% of the value added of industry and services, one of the highest globally.

title: Low Particulate Emission Damage
description: In 2021, Tonga's adjusted savings from particulate emission damage was $1.56 million, indicating minimal environmental degradation from air pollution.

title: Limited Female Employment in Leadership
description: In 2023, only 17.45% of employed females in Tonga held employer positions, suggesting gender disparities in leadership roles.

title: Small Male Population in Early 30s
description: As of 2023, males aged 30-34 made up just 4.54% of the male population, reflecting demographic trends and potential workforce implications.
